author: Shelley Ng
title: Air traffic controller in Springdale, Ark. arrested on suspicion of intoxication posts bail - @4029news
text:
Air Traffic Controller arrested on suspicion of public intox bonds out of jail UPDATED 12:03 PM CDT Jul 17, 2015 
Update: Philip Maschek has bonded out of jail, according to police. Related 
According to police, an air traffic controller was arrested on suspicion of public intoxication Thursday morning. 
An employee said they found Philip Maschek, 50, passed out in a chair with no shirt on. 
The Springdale Director of Finance met with police and told them a plane was waiting to take off, but the pilot received no response from the controller on the tower radio. 
After several failed attempts, the pilot notified the city that something "may be amiss." 
Officers said they notice Maschek was swaying back and forth. 
They had Maschek take several field sobriety tests. 
Police said they arrested him on suspicion of public intoxication and he was escorted from the airport.
